Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Change password login page 'Username or Email' field to just 'Email'" (#9877) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/5309

The Password login page (deprecated, but still used for password-based account recovery) has a 'Username or Email' field that only accepts Emails. Usernames do not work here, and this has caused confusion for customers multiple times. This field should just say 'Email' or 'Email Address', so I've fixed that now.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Can not use "https://int.nugettest.org/" as source to consume nuget pkg" (#9874) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

Can not use "https://int.nugettest.org/" as source to consume nuget pkg

### Repro Steps

1. Set "https://int.nugettest.org/" as source to consume nuget pkg in VS2019
![img_v3_0296_40808445-3d6f-4a07-be6c-6c626996738g](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/10097167/9909c0df-c0dd-4ec9-875b-6e376e06079e)

2. Try to get pkg to consume in VS 2019, but cannot get pkg to cosume and encounter some error
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/10097167/7fa98be1-7f9f-4e96-b11b-e358ea2e8729)


### Expected Behavior

Expect can use "https://int.nugettest.org/" as source and search some nuget pkg and install to consume

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[UI] Add new themes to Packages List view page " (#9852) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9854
Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/ZaAD9rDujh8JDkRF4q9Fd8/NuGet---Simple-theme-updates?type=design&node-id=61%3A9109&mode=design&t=Urj8iIoXc4thBO3E-1
Spec: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/pull/5209
## Description

These PR add's colors/theme for the Package List view, for this page we added:
- transparent button
- new styles for checkbox and radio buttons
- new style for switch.
- new theme for badges.

#### Dark Theme
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/9e37c137-f88c-40c6-a318-916425bb8b32) 

#### Light Theme
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/b1712728-79fb-4882-bd4b-17744e4b5018)

### Transparent button
#### States

|  State | Dark |  Light |  
|---|---|---|
| Focused | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/a6c8db99-4552-43db-9130-eab66bcada10)  | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/acaa4eac-ae92-4690-ba04-fcff38d9e962)  | 
| Hover | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/2f5dfb63-105f-4eb0-a8c1-ad5414b5ea01)  | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/ca5eb696-f1d0-49a7-b722-1eff23c0f658)| 
|  Pressed | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/32cd793e-3b1e-47e3-af57-6f9758285b34)| ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/dcca4a34-7d74-4230-ba5f-7c5681cd3c25) | 
| Rest | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/ea3ad213-f235-4e2d-95e1-d051152a6acb) | ![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/fbec4f06-8e19-44c1-9108-5c4897e11db2)|



#### Checkbox, Switch and TreeView
The icon button uses the new transparent button so the styles are the same.

##### Dark
![checkbox-dark-theme](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/3db32eb6-95b7-4990-b8b7-fdd5c53e266d)

##### Light
![checkbox-light-theme](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/2496af8d-1d53-4666-8c58-262313d3ec36)


#### Radio button
![radiobutton-dark-theme](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/6bb6246b-1c58-4f7a-ab5f-f3beb43ee802)



#### Badges

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/7cf8deb5-9651-4dec-b333-a6dd458a945e)
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/63d1a3ff-d625-4eb9-b754-0bfb8e4389d8)


#### Accessibility errors
### Links color are not accessible enough
I'll contact designers again to ask for guidance here. There are two options, add an underline for these kinds of links or change the color of hyperlinks
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/43253759/41327d7e-bf71-48af-894c-f835f07931c3)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2024.03.21] RI dev to main" (#9876) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[.NET 9 Preview 3] no-op restore is no longer a no-op" (#13269) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK 9.0.100-preview.3.24126.2

### Worked before?

.NET SDK 9.0.100-preview.2.24122.3

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

We discovered here a test failure: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/8763

The underlying cause appears to be:
```
The restore inputs for 'UnnamedProject' have changed. Continuing restore.
```

This was an incremental build with no changes to the project.

Digging deeper, the offending build seems to have some NuGet sources listed twice:
```diff
++https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
++https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_packaging/dotnet8/nuget/v3/index.json
https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_packaging/dotnet8/nuget/v3/index.json
```
So there must be something that adds extra feeds, making the no-op restore skip? so it runs a full restore?

### Verbose Logs

Here are two `.binlog` files, `install2.binlog` restores as expected, `install3.binlog` does not:
[nuget-noop.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/14421956/nuget-noop.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""dotnet restore --locked-mode" does not respect global.json" (#13344) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET Core SDK v8.0.202

### Worked before?

I do not think so

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Hi,

I have a project using:
`<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.BlazorWebAssembly">`
 and 
`<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile>`

I get an auto-referenced package added to the "packages.lock.json" file:
```
{
  "version": 2,
  "dependencies": {
    "net8.0": {
      ...
      "Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks": {
        "type": "Direct",
        "requested": "[8.0.2, )",
        "resolved": "8.0.2",
        "contentHash": "hKTrehpfVzOhAz0mreaTAZgbz0DrMEbWq4n3hAo8Ks6WdxdqQhNPvzOqn9VygKuWf1bmxPdraqzTaXriO/sn0A=="
      },      
      ...
```

I do not have a direct reference to "Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks". It is also marked with "(A)" when doing a "dotnet list .\Client.csproj package":

```
Project 'Client' has the following package references
   [net8.0]: 
   Top-level Package                                     Requested        Resolved      
   > Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.WebAssembly         8.0.2            8.0.2
   > Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client                 8.0.2            8.0.2
   > Microsoft.Extensions.Http                           8.0.0            8.0.0
   > Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Configuration          8.0.0            8.0.0
   > Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks                    (A)   [8.0.2, )        8.0.2
   > Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WebAssembly.Pack            (A)   [8.0.2, )        8.0.2

```

I have a global.json file that looks like this:
```
{
  "sdk": {
    "version": "8.0.200",
    "rollForward": "disable"
  }
}
```

When running "dotnet restore --force-evaluate" it respects the SDK version in global.json and updates the packages.lock.json file to use v8.0.2 of Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks:
```
"Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks": {
  "type": "Direct",
  "requested": "[8.0.2, )",
  "resolved": "8.0.2",
  "contentHash": "hKTrehpfVzOhAz0mreaTAZgbz0DrMEbWq4n3hAo8Ks6WdxdqQhNPvzOqn9VygKuWf1bmxPdraqzTaXriO/sn0A=="
},
```

The Microsoft-hosted agents have [v8.0.202 installed](https://github.com/actions/runner-images/blob/main/images/windows/Windows2022-Readme.md#net-core-tools) and when running "dotnet restore --locked-mode" it does not respect global.json and fails:
"error NU1004: The package reference Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WebAssembly.Pack version has changed from [8.0.3, ) to [8.0.2, ).The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file."

```
- task: PowerShell@2
  displayName: 'Restore NuGet packages'
  inputs:
    targetType: 'inline'
    script: |
      dotnet restore --locked-mode --configfile "$(Build.SourcesDirectory)/NuGet.config"
```

Best Regards,
Anders Havn

### Expected Behavior

"dotnet restore --locked-mode" also respects the .NET SDK version in global.json.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`dotnet new console` hangs because it tries to connect via IPv6 when I do not have a public IPv6 address, and will not fall back to IPv4." (#13329) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

8.0.102

### Worked before?

First time using .NET

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Get Fedora Linux 39, Kernel version 6.6.7 (or 6.7.9)
2. Install `dotnet` via `dnf`. Install `nuget` through there too.
3. Run `dotnet new console` or `dotnet restore`
4. It hangs while "determining projects to restore".

I have confirmed I can reach the nuget api via `curl https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`. Also, my $HOME variable does not have a slash after it. I'm also not using a Docker container.

This is a duplicate of #12467 but that one ended in the author saying it "fixed itself". This, of course, does not apply to me. 
Somebody in that thread said they "couldn't easily test arch linux", do know that [Fedora is avaliable under WSL just like Arch](https://apps.microsoft.com/detail/9npcp8drchsn?hl=en-US&gl=US). However, it might also help to try and reproduce this under a VM, in case WSL introduces some extra stuff that makes the issue unreproducable.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
➜  onedrive98 dotnet new console           

Welcome to .NET 8.0!
---------------------
SDK Version: 8.0.102

----------------
Write your first app: https://aka.ms/dotnet-hello-world
Find out what's new: https://aka.ms/dotnet-whats-new
Explore documentation: https://aka.ms/dotnet-docs
Report issues and find source on GitHub: https://github.com/dotnet/core
Use 'dotnet --help' to see available commands or visit: https://aka.ms/dotnet-cli
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The template "Console App" was created successfully.

Processing post-creation actions...
Restoring /home/gavin/Projects/onedrive98/onedrive98.csproj:
  Determining projects to restore...
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Using the 'TargetFrameworks' and 'OutputPath' causes command 'dotnet pack  --artifacts-path' to be abnormal" (#13295) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

dotnet sdk 8.0.200

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

## Description
Both `TargetFrameworks` and `OutputPath` Property are defined in the project file, the `dll` in the `lib` directory in the `.nupkg` file is the same

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>net40;net45;net48;net8.0</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Debug|AnyCPU' ">
    <OutputPath>.\Export\Debug\</OutputPath>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Release|AnyCPU' ">
    <OutputPath>.\Export\Release\</OutputPath>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

use command
```
dotnet pack "./Log.Simple.csproj"  --artifacts-path C:\packs
```

## Expected behavior
`Log.Simple.nupkg\lib\net40\Log.Simple.dll ` is not equal `Log.Simple.nupkg\lib\net8.0\Log.Simple.dll `

## Actual behavior
`Log.Simple.nupkg\lib\net40\Log.Simple.dll ` equal `Log.Simple.nupkg\lib\net8.0\Log.Simple.dll `

## Analysis
use `dotnet pack "./Log.Simple.csproj" ` I get msbuild partial log
```
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\net48\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\net45\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\net8.0\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\net40\Log.Simple.dll
```

use `dotnet pack "./Log.Simple.csproj" --artifacts-path C:\packs ` I get msbuild partial log
```
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\Log.Simple.dll
Log.Simple -> C:\Workspace\Common\Export\Release\Log.Simple.dll
```

## 环境
```
.NET SDK:
 Version:           8.0.200
 Commit:            438cab6a9d
 Workload version:  8.0.200-manifests.e575128c

运行时环境:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19045
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\8.0.200\
```



### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Failure to search packages on ProGet with error "Could not cast or convert from System.String to System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1[System.String]."" (#13343) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.10 Preview 2

### Worked before?

17.10 Preview1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Connect Visual Studio to a [ProGet feed](https://inedo.com/proget)
2. Launch Package Manager

Packages fail to load with this error in the output window:

```
[proget2] Error converting value "serilog" to type 'System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1[System.String]'. Path 'data[7].owners', line 4551, position 25.
  Could not cast or convert from System.String to System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1[System.String].

```

The only change we can find that could cause this is https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/5605

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: `nuget.exe -ExcludeVersion` does not install newer/older package versions" (#11016) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

5.10.0.7240

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. nuget install Newtonsoft.Json -Version 12.0.3 -ExcludeVersion -PackageSaveMode nuspec
```
...
Added package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.3' to folder 'C:\Users\huangqinjin\Projects\test'
Successfully installed 'Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.3' to C:\Users\huangqinjin\Projects\test
...
```
2. nuget install Newtonsoft.Json -Version 13.0.1 -ExcludeVersion -PackageSaveMode nuspec
```
...
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget.exe CLI not getting correct versions when running in -ExcludeVersion mode" (#12384) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

Nuget 6.4.0.123

### Worked before?

unknown

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Context

When using Install -ExcludeVersion mode and changing the desired version in packages.config, Nuget.exe does not actually replace the package with the desired version.  Note that this issue only occurs when the packages are already cached -- if the cache is freshly cleared using `nuget locals all -clear`, this does not occur.  `-nocache` does not help.

#### Repro Steps

In powershell, in a fresh folder, execute the following:

    if(Test-path packages) {rm packages -r}

    '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
    <packages>
      <package id="SqlServer" version="21.0.17099" />
    </packages>' > packages.config

    '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
    <configuration>
      <packageSources>
        <clear />
        <add key="PSGallery" value="https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/" />
      </packageSources>
      <config>
        <add key="repositoryPath" value=".\packages" />
      </config>
    </configuration>' > nuget.config

    Write-Output "* INSTALLING OLD VERSION *"

    nuget install packages.config -excludeversion -verbosity detailed

    Write-Output "* DOWNLOADED VERSION: $((Import-PowershellDataFile "./packages/SqlServer/SqlServer.psd1").ModuleVersion) *"

    '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
    <packages>
      <package id="SqlServer" version="21.1.18245" />
    </packages>' > packages.config

    Write-Output "* INSTALLING NEW VERSION *"

    nuget install packages.config -excludeversion -verbosity detailed

    Write-Output "* DOWNLOADED VERSION: $((Import-PowershellDataFile "./packages/SqlServer/SqlServer.psd1").ModuleVersion) *"

See in the logs below, the DOWNLOADED VERSION remains unchanged after the second `nuget install` command.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
* INSTALLING OLD VERSION *
NuGet Version: 6.4.0.123
Feeds used:
  C:\Users\zaratem\.nuget\packages\
  https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/

Restoring NuGet package SqlServer.21.0.17099.
Adding package 'SqlServer.21.0.17099' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages'
Added package 'SqlServer.21.0.17099' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages'
Added package 'SqlServer.21.0.17099' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages' from source 'C:\Users\zaratem\.nuget\packages\'
* DOWNLOADED VERSION: 21.0.17099 *
* INSTALLING NEW VERSION *
NuGet Version: 6.4.0.123
Feeds used:
  C:\Users\zaratem\.nuget\packages\
  https://www.powershellgallery.com/api/v2/

Restoring NuGet package SqlServer.21.1.18245.
Adding package 'SqlServer.21.1.18245' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages'
Added package 'SqlServer.21.1.18245' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages'
Added package 'SqlServer.21.1.18245' to folder 'C:\temp\NugetBugDemo\packages' from source 'C:\Users\zaratem\.nuget\packages\'
* DOWNLOADED VERSION: 21.0.17099 *
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Project.assets.json inconsistency between VS 17.9.2 and dotnet 8.0.200 cmd line" (#13292) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

VS Pro 17.9.2, dotnet 8.0.200

### Worked before?

Can't say, we just migrated GUI projects to net6

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

# Context
- 1500 projects, only ~10 loaded
- All loaded projects target net48 & net6.0-windows with UseWindowsForm=true property.
- All GUI projects depend (directly or not) to a unique project, let's call it Gui.Core.
- Other unloaded referenced projects are not GUI related, they target net48 & net6.0-windows or only netstandard2.0. Could be exe or libs.
- `global.json`: `8.0.100 latestFeature`
- `dotnet --version 8.0.200` in the repo.

# Expected behavior

> This is what happens with the command line.

- In GUI.Core project.assets.json: ... > frameworks > net6.0-windows7.0 > frameworkReferences > Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.WindowsForms
- In project.assets.json of other projects: ... > Gui.Core/VERSION > frameworkReferences > Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.WindowsForms

# Actual behavior

> In VisualStudio Professional 17.9.2

- In GUI.Core project.assets.json: ... > frameworks > net6.0-windows7.0 > frameworkReferences > Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App (WindowsForms has been remove as-if project also had UseWPF=true which is not the case)
- In project.assets.json of other projects: ... > Gui.Core/VERSION > frameworkReferences > Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App (WindowsForms also removed)
- Similar differences in *.dgspec.json files

# Analysis

- Adding UseWPF=false (which is the default!) in Gui.Core.csproj fixes the problem (but it should not be needed).

# Side notes
- No problem with VS 17.8.x but GUI projects were not targeting net6 yet.
- I cannot provide a small repro.
- Being able to get diagnostic NuGet logs while restoring in VS would be nice, but I do not know how to proceed. An alternative would be to be able to restore in command line using VS binaries & context (how to proceed?)
- Only one project in the repo with UseWPF=true, a GUI test project not in the dependency graph of the loaded projects.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024" (#72) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as April 8th, 2024. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by April 8th, 2024 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org that are signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-april-8th-2024/

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Microsoft Security Advisory CVE-2024-0057 | NuGet Client Security Feature bypass Vulnerability" (#71) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: # Microsoft Security Advisory CVE-2024-0057 | NuGet Client Security Feature bypass Vulnerability ## Executive summary Microsoft is releasing this security advisory to provide information about a vulnerability in .NET 6.0, .NET 7.0 and .NET 8.0 . This advisory also provides guidance on what developers can do to update their applications to address this vulnerability. A security feature bypass vulnerability exists when Microsoft .NET Framework-based applications use X.509 chain building APIs but do not completely validate the X.509 certificate due to a logic flaw. An attacker could present an arbitrary untrusted certificate with malformed signatures, triggering a bug in the framework. The framework will correctly report that X.509 chain building failed, but it will return an incorrect reason code for the failure. Applications which utilize this reason code to make their own chain building trust decisions may inadvertently treat this scenario as a successful chain build. This could allow an adversary to subvert the app's typical authentication logic. ## Discussion Discussion for this issue can be found at ## Mitigation factors Within .NET, only the WindowsDesktop shared runtime contains inbox components which utilize X.509 chain building APIs in a vulnerable manner. Other project types, such as web applications, are not impacted by this vulnerability unless they explicitly invoke the X.509 chain building APIs themselves in a vulnerable manner or they consume an external package which does this on their behalf. ## Affected software ### NuGet & NuGet Packages - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.8.0 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.7.0 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.6.1 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.4.2 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.3.3 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 6.0.5 version or earlier. - Any NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet.Packaging 5.11.5 version or earlier. [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/security/advisories/GHSA-68w7-72jg-6qpp) ### .NET SDK(s) - Any .NET SDK 6.0.126 or earlier, or 6.0.418 or earlier. - Any .NET SDK 7.0.115 or earlier, or 7.0.312 or earlier, or 7.0.405 or earlier. - Any .NET SDK 8.0.101 or earlier. ### How do I know if I am affected? If you have a NuGet package or .NET SDK with a version listed in [affected software](#affected-software), you're exposed to the vulnerability. ### How do I fix the issue? To fix the issue, please install the latest version of .NET 6.0, .NET 7.0 or .NET 8.0 and NuGet (NuGet.exe, NuGet.CommandLine, NuGet. Packaging versions). If you have installed one or more .NET SDKs through Visual Studio, Visual Studio will prompt you to update Visual Studio, which will also update your .NET SDKs. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.8.0 or lower, you should download and install 6.8.1 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.8.1/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.7.0 or lower, you should download and install 6.7.1 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.7.1/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.6.1 or lower, you should download and install 6.6.2 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.6.2/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.4.2 or lower, you should download and install 6.4.3 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.4.3/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.3.3 or lower, you should download and install 6.3.4 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.3.4/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 6.0.5 or lower, you should download and install 6.0.6 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v6.0.6/nuget.exe. - If you're using NuGet.exe 5.11.5 or lower, you should download and install 5.11.6 from https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v5.11.6/nuget.exe. You can get the version of NuGet.exe by running the `nuget` command. You should see an output like the following: ``` NuGet Version: 6.0.0.280 usage: NuGet [args] [options] Type 'NuGet help ' for help on a specific command. To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://www.nuget.org/downloads ``` You can list the versions you have installed by running the `dotnet --info` command. You should see an output like the following: ``` .NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json): Version: 6.0.300 Commit: 8473146e7d Runtime Environment: OS Name: Windows OS Version: 10.0.18363 OS Platform: Windows RID: win10-x64 Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.300\ Host (useful for support): Version: 6.0.5 Commit: 8473146e7d .NET Core SDKs installed: 6.0.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk] .NET Core runtimes installed: Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.5 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs: https://aka.ms/dotnet-download ``` - If you're using .NET 8.0, you should download and install .NET 8.0.102 SDK (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.8) from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/8.0. - If you're using .NET 7.0, you should download and install SDK 7.0.116 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.4), or SDK 7.0.313 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.6), or 7.0.406 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.7) from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/7.0. - If you're using .NET 6.0, you should download and install SDK 6.0.127 or SDK 6.0.419 (for Visual Studio 2022 v17.3) from https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core/6.0. Once you have installed the updated runtime or SDK, restart your apps for the update to take effect. Additionally, if you've deployed self-contained applications targeting any of the impacted versions, these applications are also vulnerable and must be recompiled and redeployed. ## Other Information ### Reporting Security Issues If you have found a potential security issue in .NET 8.0 or .NET 7.0 or .NET 6.0, please email details to secure@microsoft.com. Reports may qualify for the Microsoft .NET Core & .NET Bounty. Details of the Microsoft .NET Bounty Program including terms and conditions are at https://aka.ms/corebounty. ### Support You can ask questions about this issue on GitHub in the .NET GitHub organization. The main repo is located at https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client . The Announcements repo will contain this bulletin as an issue and will include a link to a discussion issue. You can ask questions in the linked discussion issue. ### Disclaimer The information provided in this advisory is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. Microsoft disclaims all warranties, either express or implied, including the warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers be liable for any damages whatsoever including direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, loss of business profits or special damages, even if Microsoft Corporation or its suppliers have been advised of the possibility of such damages. Some states do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for consequential or incidental damages so the foregoing limitation may not apply. ### External Links [CVE 2024-0057](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-release?version=GBfeb24&path=/AdvisoryDrafts/CVE-2024-0057.md) ### Revisions V1.0 (February 13, 2024): Advisory published. _Version 1.0_ _Last Updated 2024-02-13_
